texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. The State shall ensure the elimination of all forms of exploitation and  the  gradual  fulfillment  of  the  fundamental  principle,  from  each according to his ability to each according to his work.
texts.text: 3. The State shall ensure the elimination of all forms of exploitation and  the  gradual  fulfillment  of  the  fundamental  principle,  from  each according to his ability to each according to his work.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Right of individuals to be dealt with in accordance with law, etc.
texts.text: Right of individuals to be dealt with in accordance with law, etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. (1) To enjoy the protection of law and to be treated in accordance with law is the inalienable right of every citizen. Wherever he may be, and of every other person for the time being within Pakistan.
texts.text: 4. (1) To enjoy the protection of law and to be treated in accordance with law is the inalienable right of every citizen. Wherever he may be, and of every other person for the time being within Pakistan.

texts.text: (a) no action detrimental to the life, liberty, body, reputation  or  property  of  any  person  shall  be  taken except in accordance with law;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) no  person  shall  be  prevented  from  or  be  hindered  in doing that which is not prohibited by law; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) no person shall be compelled to do that which the law does not required him to do.
texts.text: (c) no person shall be compelled to do that which the law does not required him to do.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Loyalty to State and obedience to Constitution and law

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. (1)      Loyalty to the State is the basic duty of every citizen.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Obedience to the Constitution and law is the 1 [inviolable] obligation of every citizen wherever he may be and of every other person for the time being within Pakistan.
texts.text: (2) Obedience to the Constitution and law is the 1 [inviolable] obligation of every citizen wherever he may be and of every other person for the time being within Pakistan.

In  this  Part,  unless  the  context  otherwise  requires,  "the  State" means the Federal Government, 1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)], a Provincial  Government,  a  Provincial  Assembly,  and  such  local  or  other authorities in Pakistan as are by law empowered to impose any tax or cess.
texts.text: 7. texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Laws inconsistent with or in derogation of Fundamental Rights to be void
texts.text: Laws inconsistent with or in derogation of Fundamental Rights to be void

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 8. (1)    Any law, or any custom or usage having the force of law, in so far as it is inconsistent with the rights conferred by this Chapter, shall, to the extent of such inconsistency, be void.
texts.text: 8. (1)    Any law, or any custom or usage having the force of law, in so far as it is inconsistent with the rights conferred by this Chapter, shall, to the extent of such inconsistency, be void.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) The  State  shall  not  make  any  law  which  takes  away  or abridges the rights so conferred and any law made in contravention of this clause shall, to the extent of such contravention, be void.
texts.text: (2) The  State  shall  not  make  any  law  which  takes  away  or abridges the rights so conferred and any law made in contravention of this clause shall, to the extent of such contravention, be void.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Security of person
texts.text: Security of person

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 9. No person shall be deprived of life or liberty save in accordance with law.
texts.text: 9. No person shall be deprived of life or liberty save in accordance with law.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Safeguards as to arrest and detention
texts.text: Safeguards as to arrest and detention

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 10. (1) No  person  who  is  arrested  shall  be  detained  in  custody without being informed, as soon as may be, of the grounds for such arrest, nor  shall  he  be  denied  the  right  to  consult  and  be  defended  by  a  legal practitioner of his choice.
texts.text: 10. (1) No  person  who  is  arrested  shall  be  detained  in  custody without being informed, as soon as may be, of the grounds for such arrest, nor  shall  he  be  denied  the  right  to  consult  and  be  defended  by  a  legal practitioner of his choice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Every person who is arrested and detained in custody shall be produced before a magistrate within a period of twenty-four hours of such arrest, excluding the time necessary for the journey from the place of arrest to the court of the nearest magistrate, and no such person shall be detained  in  custody  beyond  the  said  period  with  out  the  authority  of  a magistrate.
texts.text: (2) Every person who is arrested and detained in custody shall be produced before a magistrate within a period of twenty-four hours of such arrest, excluding the time necessary for the journey from the place of arrest to the court of the nearest magistrate, and no such person shall be detained  in  custody  beyond  the  said  period  with  out  the  authority  of  a magistrate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) Nothing  in  clauses  (1)  and  (2)  shall  apply  to  any  person who  is  arrested  or  detained  under  any  law  providing  for  preventive detention.
texts.text: (3) Nothing  in  clauses  (1)  and  (2)  shall  apply  to  any  person who  is  arrested  or  detained  under  any  law  providing  for  preventive detention.

texts.text: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (4) No law providing for preventive detention shall be made except to  deal  with  persons  acting  in  a  manner  prejudicial  to  the  integrity, security or defence of Pakistan or any part thereof, or external affairs of Pakistan, or public order, or the maintenance of supplies or services, and no  such  law  shall  authorise  the  detention  of  a  person  for  a  period exceeding 1 [three months] unless the appropriate Review Board has, after affording him an opportunity of being heard in person, reviewed his case and reported, before the expiration of the said period, that there is, in its opinion,  sufficient  cause  for  such  detention,  and,  if  the  detention  is continued after the said period of '[three months], unless the appropriate Review Board has reviewed his case and reported, before the expiration of each period of three months, that there is, in its opinion, sufficient cause for such detention.
texts.text: (4) No law providing for preventive detention shall be made except to  deal  with  persons  acting  in  a  manner  prejudicial  to  the  integrity, security or defence of Pakistan or any part thereof, or external affairs of Pakistan, or public order, or the maintenance of supplies or services, and no  such  law  shall  authorise  the  detention  of  a  person  for  a  period exceeding 1 [three months] unless the appropriate Review Board has, after affording him an opportunity of being heard in person, reviewed his case and reported, before the expiration of the said period, that there is, in its opinion,  sufficient  cause  for  such  detention,  and,  if  the  detention  is continued after the said period of '[three months], unless the appropriate Review Board has reviewed his case and reported, before the expiration of each period of three months, that there is, in its opinion, sufficient cause for such detention.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation I. -In  this  Article, " the  appropriate  Review  Board" means,
texts.text: Explanation I. -In  this  Article, " the  appropriate  Review  Board" means,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) in the case of a person detained under a Federal law, a Board appointed by the Chief Justice of Pakistan and consisting of a Chairman and two other persons, each of whom is or has been a Judge of the Supreme Court or a High Court; and
texts.text: (i) in the case of a person detained under a Federal law, a Board appointed by the Chief Justice of Pakistan and consisting of a Chairman and two other persons, each of whom is or has been a Judge of the Supreme Court or a High Court; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) in the case of a person detained under a Provincial law, a Board appointed by the Chief Justice of the High Court concerned and consisting of a Chairman and two other persons, each of whom is or has been a Judge of a High Court.
texts.text: (ii) in the case of a person detained under a Provincial law, a Board appointed by the Chief Justice of the High Court concerned and consisting of a Chairman and two other persons, each of whom is or has been a Judge of a High Court.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation II. -The  opinion  of  a  Review  Board  shall  be expressed in terms of the views of the majority of its members.
texts.text: Explanation II. -The  opinion  of  a  Review  Board  shall  be expressed in terms of the views of the majority of its members.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5) When any person is detained in pursuance of an order made under any law providing for preventive detention, the authority making the order  shall, 2 [within  fifteen  days]  from  such  detention,  communicate  to such  person  the  grounds  on  which  the  order  has  been  made,  and  shall afford him the earliest opportunity of making a representation against the order :
texts.text: (5) When any person is detained in pursuance of an order made under any law providing for preventive detention, the authority making the order  shall, 2 [within  fifteen  days]  from  such  detention,  communicate  to such  person  the  grounds  on  which  the  order  has  been  made,  and  shall afford him the earliest opportunity of making a representation against the order :

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided that the authority making any such order may refuse to disclose facts which such authority considers it to be against the public interest to disclose.
texts.text: Provided that the authority making any such order may refuse to disclose facts which such authority considers it to be against the public interest to disclose.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7) Within a period of twenty-four months commencing on the day  of  his  first  detention  in  pursuance  of  an  order  made  under  a  law providing for preventive detention, no person shall be detained in pursuance of any such order for more than a total period of eight months in the case of a person detained for acting in a manner prejudicial to public order and twelve months in any other case :
texts.text: (7) Within a period of twenty-four months commencing on the day  of  his  first  detention  in  pursuance  of  an  order  made  under  a  law providing for preventive detention, no person shall be detained in pursuance of any such order for more than a total period of eight months in the case of a person detained for acting in a manner prejudicial to public order and twelve months in any other case :

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided  that  this  clause  shall  not  apply  to  any  person  who  is employed  by,  or  works  for,  or  acts  on  instructions  received  from,  the enemy  1 [, or who is acting or attempting to act in a manner prejudicial to the  integrity,  security  or  defence  of  Pakistan  or  any  part  thereof  or  who commits or attempts to commit any act which amounts to an anti-national activity  as  defined  in  a  Federal  law  or  is  a  member  of  any  association which  has  for  its  objects,  or  which  indulges  in,  any  such  anti  national activity].

Every  citizen  shall  have  the  right  to  freedom  of  speech  and expression,  and  there  shall  be  freedom  of  the  press,  subject  to  any reasonable  restrictions  imposed  by  law  in  the  interest  of  the  glory  of Islam or the integrity, security or defence of Pakistan or any part thereof, friendly relations with foreign States, public order, decency or morality, or in relation to contempt of court, 1 [commission of] or incitement to an offence.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22. (1) No  person  attending  any  educational  institution  shall  be required  to  receive  religious  instruction,  or  take  part  in  any  religious ceremony, or attend  religious  worship,  if  such  instruction,  ceremony  or worship relates to a religion other than his own.
texts.text: 22. (1) No  person  attending  any  educational  institution  shall  be required  to  receive  religious  instruction,  or  take  part  in  any  religious ceremony, or attend  religious  worship,  if  such  instruction,  ceremony  or worship relates to a religion other than his own.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) In  respect  of  any  religious  institution,  there shall  be  no  discrimination  against  any  community  in  the granting of exemption or concession in relation to taxation.
texts.text: (2) In  respect  of  any  religious  institution,  there shall  be  no  discrimination  against  any  community  in  the granting of exemption or concession in relation to taxation.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (3) Subject to law,

texts.text: (a) no  religious  community  or  denomination  shall  be prevented  from  providing  religious  instruction  for pupils  of  that  community  or  denomination  in  any educational  institution  maintained  wholly  by  that community or denomination; and

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (4) Nothing  in  this  Article  shall  prevent  any  public  authority from making provision for the advancement of any socially or educationally backward class of citizens.

texts.orig: 23. Every citizen shall have the right to acquire, hold and dispose of property  in  any  part  of  Pakistan,  subject  to  the  Constitution  and  any reasonable restrictions imposed by law in the public interest.
texts.text: 23. Every citizen shall have the right to acquire, hold and dispose of property  in  any  part  of  Pakistan,  subject  to  the  Constitution  and  any reasonable restrictions imposed by law in the public interest.

texts.text: Protection of property rights

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24. (1) No  person shall be deprived of his property save in accordance with law.
texts.text: 24. (1) No  person shall be deprived of his property save in accordance with law.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) No  property shall be compulsorily acquired or taken possession of save for a public purpose, and save by the authority of law which provides for compensation therefor and either fixes the amount of compensation  or  specifies  the  principles  on  and  the  manner  in  which compensation is to be determined and given.
texts.text: (2) No  property shall be compulsorily acquired or taken possession of save for a public purpose, and save by the authority of law which provides for compensation therefor and either fixes the amount of compensation  or  specifies  the  principles  on  and  the  manner  in  which compensation is to be determined and given.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (a) any law permitting the compulsory acquisition or taking possession of any property for preventing danger to life, property or public health; or

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (b) any  law  permitting  the  taking  over  of  any  property which has been acquired by, or come into the possession  of,  any  person  by  any  unfair  means,  or  in any manner, contrary to law; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) any  law  relating  to  the  acquisition,  administration  or disposal  of  any  property  which  is  or  is  deemed  to  be enemy property or evacuee property under any law (not being property which has ceased to be evacuee property under any law); or
texts.text: (c) any  law  relating  to  the  acquisition,  administration  or disposal  of  any  property  which  is  or  is  deemed  to  be enemy property or evacuee property under any law (not being property which has ceased to be evacuee property under any law); or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) any law providing for the taking over of the management of any property by the State for a limited period, either in the public interest or in order to secure the  proper  management  of  the  property,  or  for  the benefit of its owner; or
texts.text: (d) any law providing for the taking over of the management of any property by the State for a limited period, either in the public interest or in order to secure the  proper  management  of  the  property,  or  for  the benefit of its owner; or

texts.text: (i) providing  education  and  medical  aid  to  all  or  any specified class of citizens; or

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (ii) providing housing and public facilities and services such  as  roads,  water  supply,  sewerage,  gas  and electric power  to  all or  any  specified  class of citizens; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (iii) providing maintenance to those who, on account of unemployment,  sickness,  infirmity  or  old  age,  are unable to maintain themselves; or
texts.text: (iii) providing maintenance to those who, on account of unemployment,  sickness,  infirmity  or  old  age,  are unable to maintain themselves; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) any  existing  law  or  any  law  made  in  pursuance  of Article 253.
texts.text: (f) any  existing  law  or  any  law  made  in  pursuance  of Article 253.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (4) The adequacy or otherwise of any compensation provided for  by  any  such  law  as  is  referred  to  in  this  Article,  or  determined  in pursuance thereof, shall not be called in question in any court.

texts.text: Safeguard against discrimination in services

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 27. (1) No  citizen otherwise qualified for appointment in the service of Pakistan shall be discriminated against in respect of any such appointment on the ground only of race, religion, caste, sex, residence or place of birth:
texts.text: 27. (1) No  citizen otherwise qualified for appointment in the service of Pakistan shall be discriminated against in respect of any such appointment on the ground only of race, religion, caste, sex, residence or place of birth:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided that,  for  a  period  not  exceeding 3 [forty]  years  from  the commencing  day,  posts  may  be  reserved  for  persons  belonging  to  any class  or  area  to  secure  their  adequate  representation  in  the  service  of Pakistan:
texts.text: Provided that,  for  a  period  not  exceeding 3 [forty]  years  from  the commencing  day,  posts  may  be  reserved  for  persons  belonging  to  any class  or  area  to  secure  their  adequate  representation  in  the  service  of Pakistan:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided further that, in the interest of the said service, specified posts or services may be reserved for members of either sex if such posts or services entail the performance of duties and functions which cannot be adequately performed by members of the other sex 4 [:]
texts.text: Provided further that, in the interest of the said service, specified posts or services may be reserved for members of either sex if such posts or services entail the performance of duties and functions which cannot be adequately performed by members of the other sex 4 [:]

texts.orig: (2) Nothing in clause (1) shall prevent any Provincial Government, or any local or other authority in a Province, from prescribing, in relation to any  post or class of service under  that Government or authority, conditions as to residence in the Province, for a period not exceeding three years, prior to appointment under that Government or authority.
texts.text: (2) Nothing in clause (1) shall prevent any Provincial Government, or any local or other authority in a Province, from prescribing, in relation to any  post or class of service under  that Government or authority, conditions as to residence in the Province, for a period not exceeding three years, prior to appointment under that Government or authority.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Preservation of language, script and culture
texts.text: Preservation of language, script and culture

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 28. Subject  to  Article  251  any  section  of  citizens  having  a  distinct language, script or culture shall have the right to preserve and promote the same and subject to law, establish institutions for that purpose.
texts.text: 28. Subject  to  Article  251  any  section  of  citizens  having  a  distinct language, script or culture shall have the right to preserve and promote the same and subject to law, establish institutions for that purpose.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CHAPTER 2. -PRINCIPLES OF POLICY
texts.text: CHAPTER 2. -PRINCIPLES OF POLICY

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Principles of Policy
texts.text: Principles of Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 29. (1)    The Principles set out in this Chapter shall be known as the Principles of Policy, and it is the responsibility of each organ and authority of  the  State,  and  of  each  person  performing  functions  on  behalf  of  an organ or authority of the State, to act in accordance with those Principles in so far as they relate to the functions of the organ or authority.
texts.text: 29. (1)    The Principles set out in this Chapter shall be known as the Principles of Policy, and it is the responsibility of each organ and authority of  the  State,  and  of  each  person  performing  functions  on  behalf  of  an organ or authority of the State, to act in accordance with those Principles in so far as they relate to the functions of the organ or authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) In  so  far  as  the  observance  of  any  particular  Principle  of Policy may be dependent upon resources being available for the purpose, the  Principle  shall  be  regarded  as  being  subject  to  the  availability  of resources.
texts.text: (2) In  so  far  as  the  observance  of  any  particular  Principle  of Policy may be dependent upon resources being available for the purpose, the  Principle  shall  be  regarded  as  being  subject  to  the  availability  of resources.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) In  respect  of  each  year,  the  President  in  relation  to  the affairs of the Federation, and the Governor of each Province in relation to the  affairs  of  his  Province,  shall  cause  to  be  prepared  and  laid  before 2 [each House of Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or, as the case may be, the Provincial  Assembly,  a  report  on  the  observance  and  implementation  of the  Principles  of  Policy,  and  provision  shall  be  made  in  the  rules  of procedure of the National Assembly 3 [and the Senate] or, as the case may be, the Provincial Assembly, for discussion on such report.
texts.text: (3) In  respect  of  each  year,  the  President  in  relation  to  the affairs of the Federation, and the Governor of each Province in relation to the  affairs  of  his  Province,  shall  cause  to  be  prepared  and  laid  before 2 [each House of Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or, as the case may be, the Provincial  Assembly,  a  report  on  the  observance  and  implementation  of the  Principles  of  Policy,  and  provision  shall  be  made  in  the  rules  of procedure of the National Assembly 3 [and the Senate] or, as the case may be, the Provincial Assembly, for discussion on such report.

texts.text: 2 Subs. by the Constitution (Eighteenth Amdt.) Act, 2010 (10 of 2010), s. 11, for 'the National Assembly'.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN
texts.text: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Responsibility with respect to Principles of Policy
texts.text: Responsibility with respect to Principles of Policy

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 30. (1) The  responsibility  of  deciding  whether  any  action  of  an organ  or  authority  of  the  State,  or  of  a  person  performing  functions  on behalf  of  an  organ  or  authority  of  the  State,  is  in  accordance  with  the Principles of Policy is that of the organ or authority of the State, or of the person, concerned.
texts.text: 30. (1) The  responsibility  of  deciding  whether  any  action  of  an organ  or  authority  of  the  State,  or  of  a  person  performing  functions  on behalf  of  an  organ  or  authority  of  the  State,  is  in  accordance  with  the Principles of Policy is that of the organ or authority of the State, or of the person, concerned.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)    The  validity  of  an  action  or  of  a  law  shall  not  be  called  in question on the ground that it is not in accordance with the Principles of Policy, and no action shall lie against the State, any organ or authority of the State or any person on such ground.
texts.text: (2)    The  validity  of  an  action  or  of  a  law  shall  not  be  called  in question on the ground that it is not in accordance with the Principles of Policy, and no action shall lie against the State, any organ or authority of the State or any person on such ground.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Islamic way of life
texts.text: Islamic way of life

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 31. (1) Steps  shall  be  taken  to  enable  the  Muslims  of  Pakistan, individually  and  collectively,  to  order  their  lives  in  accordance  with  the fundamental  principles  and  basic  concepts  of  Islam  and  to  provide facilities whereby they may be enabled to understand the meaning of life according to the Holy Quran and Sunnah.
texts.text: 31. (1) Steps  shall  be  taken  to  enable  the  Muslims  of  Pakistan, individually  and  collectively,  to  order  their  lives  in  accordance  with  the fundamental  principles  and  basic  concepts  of  Islam  and  to  provide facilities whereby they may be enabled to understand the meaning of life according to the Holy Quran and Sunnah.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Pakistan,
texts.text: (2) Pakistan,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) to  make  the  teaching  of  the  Holy  Quran  and  Islamiat compulsory, to encourage and facilitate the learning of Arabic language and to secure correct and exact printing and publishing of the Holy Quran;
texts.text: (a) to  make  the  teaching  of  the  Holy  Quran  and  Islamiat compulsory, to encourage and facilitate the learning of Arabic language and to secure correct and exact printing and publishing of the Holy Quran;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) to  promote  unity  and  the  observance  of  the  Islamic moral standards; and
texts.text: (b) to  promote  unity  and  the  observance  of  the  Islamic moral standards; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) to secure the proper organisation of zakat 1 [ushr,] auqaf and mosques.
texts.text: (c) to secure the proper organisation of zakat 1 [ushr,] auqaf and mosques.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Promotion of local Government institutions
texts.text: Promotion of local Government institutions

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 32. The State shall encourage local Government institutions composed of elected representatives of the areas concerned and in such institutions special representation will be given to peasants, workers and women.
texts.text: 32. The State shall encourage local Government institutions composed of elected representatives of the areas concerned and in such institutions special representation will be given to peasants, workers and women.

texts.orig: 1 Ins.by P.O. No. 14 of 1985, Art. 2 and Sch.,
texts.text: 1 Ins.by P.O. No. 14 of 1985, Art. 2 and Sch.,

texts.orig: The State shall endeavour, as respects the Muslims of
texts.text: The State shall endeavour, as respects the Muslims of

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN
texts.text: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Parochial and other similar prejudices to be discouraged
texts.text: Parochial and other similar prejudices to be discouraged

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 33. The  State  shall  discourage  parochial,  racial,  tribal  sectarian  and provincial prejudices among the citizens.
texts.text: 33. The  State  shall  discourage  parochial,  racial,  tribal  sectarian  and provincial prejudices among the citizens.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Full participation of women in national life
texts.text: Full participation of women in national life

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 34. Steps  shall  be  taken  to  ensure  full  participation  of  women  in  all spheres of national life.
texts.text: 34. Steps  shall  be  taken  to  ensure  full  participation  of  women  in  all spheres of national life.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Protection of family, etc.
texts.text: Protection of family, etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 35. The State shall protect the marriage, the family, the mother and the child.
texts.text: 35. The State shall protect the marriage, the family, the mother and the child.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Protection of minorities
texts.text: Protection of minorities

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 36. The  State  shall  safeguard  the  legitimate  rights  and  interests  of minorities, including their due representation in the Federal and Provincial services.
texts.text: 36. The  State  shall  safeguard  the  legitimate  rights  and  interests  of minorities, including their due representation in the Federal and Provincial services.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Promotion of social justice and eradication of social evils
texts.text: Promotion of social justice and eradication of social evils

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 37. The State shall -
texts.text: 37. The State shall -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) promote,  with  special  care,  the  educational  and  economic interests of backward classes or areas;
texts.text: (a) promote,  with  special  care,  the  educational  and  economic interests of backward classes or areas;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) remove illiteracy and provide free and compulsory secondary education within minimum possible period;
texts.text: (b) remove illiteracy and provide free and compulsory secondary education within minimum possible period;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) make technical and professional education generally available  and  higher  education  equally  accessible  to  all  on the basis of merit;
texts.text: (c) make technical and professional education generally available  and  higher  education  equally  accessible  to  all  on the basis of merit;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) ensure inexpensive and expeditious justice;
texts.text: (d) ensure inexpensive and expeditious justice;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) make provision for securing just and humane conditions of work, ensuring that children and women are not employed in vocations  unsuited  to  their  age  or  sex,  and  for  maternity benefits for women in employment;
texts.text: (e) make provision for securing just and humane conditions of work, ensuring that children and women are not employed in vocations  unsuited  to  their  age  or  sex,  and  for  maternity benefits for women in employment;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) enable  the  people  of  different  areas,  through  education, training,  agricultural  and  industrial  development  and  other methods, to participate fully in all forms of national activities, including employment in the service of Pakistan;
texts.text: (f) enable  the  people  of  different  areas,  through  education, training,  agricultural  and  industrial  development  and  other methods, to participate fully in all forms of national activities, including employment in the service of Pakistan;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN
texts.text: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) prevent prostitution, gambling and taking of injurious drugs, printing,  publication,  circulation  and  display  of  obscene literature and advertisements;
texts.text: (g) prevent prostitution, gambling and taking of injurious drugs, printing,  publication,  circulation  and  display  of  obscene literature and advertisements;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) prevent  the  consumption  of  alcoholic  liquor  otherwise  than for  medicinal  and,  in  the  case  of  non-Muslims,  religious purposes; and
texts.text: (h) prevent  the  consumption  of  alcoholic  liquor  otherwise  than for  medicinal  and,  in  the  case  of  non-Muslims,  religious purposes; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) decentralise the Government administration so as to facilitate expeditious disposal of its business to meet the convenience and requirements of the public.
texts.text: (i) decentralise the Government administration so as to facilitate expeditious disposal of its business to meet the convenience and requirements of the public.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Promotion of social and economic well being of the people
texts.text: Promotion of social and economic well being of the people

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 38. The State shall -
texts.text: 38. The State shall -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) secure the well-being of the people, irrespective of sex, caste, creed or race, by raising their standard of living, by preventing the concentration of wealth and means of production  and  distribution  in  the  hands  of  a  few  to  the detriment of general interest and  by  ensuring  equitable adjustment of rights between employers and employees, and landlords and tenants;
texts.text: (a) secure the well-being of the people, irrespective of sex, caste, creed or race, by raising their standard of living, by preventing the concentration of wealth and means of production  and  distribution  in  the  hands  of  a  few  to  the detriment of general interest and  by  ensuring  equitable adjustment of rights between employers and employees, and landlords and tenants;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) provide for all citizens, within the available resources of the country,  facilities  for  work  and  adequate  livelihood  with reasonable rest and leisure;
texts.text: (b) provide for all citizens, within the available resources of the country,  facilities  for  work  and  adequate  livelihood  with reasonable rest and leisure;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) provide for all persons employed in the service of Pakistan or otherwise, social security by compulsory social insurance or other means;
texts.text: (c) provide for all persons employed in the service of Pakistan or otherwise, social security by compulsory social insurance or other means;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) provide  basic  necessities  of  life,  such  as  food,  clothing, housing,  education  and  medical  relief,  for  all  such  citizens, irrespective of sex, caste, creed or race, as are permanently or temporarily  unable  to  earn  their  livelihood  on  account  of infirmity, sickness or unemployment;
texts.text: (d) provide  basic  necessities  of  life,  such  as  food,  clothing, housing,  education  and  medical  relief,  for  all  such  citizens, irrespective of sex, caste, creed or race, as are permanently or temporarily  unable  to  earn  their  livelihood  on  account  of infirmity, sickness or unemployment;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) reduce  disparity  in  the  income  and  earnings  of  individuals, including  persons  in  the  various  classes  of  the  service  of Pakistan; 1 *
texts.text: (e) reduce  disparity  in  the  income  and  earnings  of  individuals, including  persons  in  the  various  classes  of  the  service  of Pakistan; 1 *

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) eliminate riba as early as possible 2 [; and]
texts.text: (f) eliminate riba as early as possible 2 [; and]

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: 1 The word 'and' omitted by the Constitution (Eighteenth Amdt.) Act, 2010 (10 of 2010), s. 12.
texts.text: 1 The word 'and' omitted by the Constitution (Eighteenth Amdt.) Act, 2010 (10 of 2010), s. 12.

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: 2 Subs. ibid ; for the full-stop.
texts.text: 2 Subs. ibid ; for the full-stop.

texts.orig: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN
texts.text: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN

texts.text: 1 [(g)  ensure that the shares of the Provinces in all Federal services, including  autonomous  bodies  and  corporations  established by, or under the control of, the Federal Government, shall be secured  and  any  omission  in  the  allocation  of  the  shares  of the Provinces in the past shall be rectified.]

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Participation of people in Armed Forces
texts.text: Participation of people in Armed Forces

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 39. The  State  shall  enable  people  from  all  parts  of  Pakistan  to participate in the Armed Forces of Pakistan.
texts.text: 39. The  State  shall  enable  people  from  all  parts  of  Pakistan  to participate in the Armed Forces of Pakistan.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Strengthening  bonds  with  Muslim  world  and  promoting international peace
texts.text: Strengthening  bonds  with  Muslim  world  and  promoting international peace

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 40. The  State  shall  endeavour  to  preserve  and  strengthen  fraternal relations  among  Muslim  countries  based  on  Islamic  unity,  support  the common  interests  of  the  peoples  of  Asia,  Africa  and  Latin  America, promote  international  peace  and  security,  foster  goodwill  and  friendly relations among all nations and encourage the settlement of international disputes by peaceful means.
texts.text: 40. The  State  shall  endeavour  to  preserve  and  strengthen  fraternal relations  among  Muslim  countries  based  on  Islamic  unity,  support  the common  interests  of  the  peoples  of  Asia,  Africa  and  Latin  America, promote  international  peace  and  security,  foster  goodwill  and  friendly relations among all nations and encourage the settlement of international disputes by peaceful means.

texts.text: PART III

texts.text: The Federation of Pakistan

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: CHAPTER 1. - THE PRESIDENT
texts.text: CHAPTER 1. - THE PRESIDENT

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: The President
texts.text: The President

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 41. (1) There  shall  be  a  President  of  Pakistan  who  shall  be  the Head of State and shall represent the unity of the Republic.
texts.text: 41. (1) There  shall  be  a  President  of  Pakistan  who  shall  be  the Head of State and shall represent the unity of the Republic.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) A  person  shall  not  be  qualified  for  election  as  President unless  he  is  a  Muslim  of  not  less  than  forty-five  years  of  age  and  is qualified to be elected as member of the National Assembly.
texts.text: (2) A  person  shall  not  be  qualified  for  election  as  President unless  he  is  a  Muslim  of  not  less  than  forty-five  years  of  age  and  is qualified to be elected as member of the National Assembly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 [(3)  The President 2 * * * shall be elected in accordance with the provisions of the Second Schedule by the members of an electoral college consisting of -
texts.text: 1 [(3)  The President 2 * * * shall be elected in accordance with the provisions of the Second Schedule by the members of an electoral college consisting of -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the members of both Houses; and
texts.text: (a) the members of both Houses; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) the members of the Provincial Assemblies.]
texts.text: (b) the members of the Provincial Assemblies.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) Election to the office of President shall be held not earlier than sixty days and not later than thirty days before the expiration of the term of the President in office:
texts.text: (4) Election to the office of President shall be held not earlier than sixty days and not later than thirty days before the expiration of the term of the President in office:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided  that,  if  the  election  cannot  be  held  within  the  period aforesaid  because  the  National  Assembly  is  dissolved,  it  shall  be  held within thirty days of the general election to the Assembly.
texts.text: Provided  that,  if  the  election  cannot  be  held  within  the  period aforesaid  because  the  National  Assembly  is  dissolved,  it  shall  be  held within thirty days of the general election to the Assembly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5) An election to fill a vacancy in the office of President shall be held not later than thirty days from the occurrence of the vacancy:
texts.text: (5) An election to fill a vacancy in the office of President shall be held not later than thirty days from the occurrence of the vacancy:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided  that,  if  the  election  cannot  be  held  within  the  period aforesaid  because  the  National  Assembly  is  dissolved,  it  shall  be  held within thirty days of the general election to the Assembly.
texts.text: Provided  that,  if  the  election  cannot  be  held  within  the  period aforesaid  because  the  National  Assembly  is  dissolved,  it  shall  be  held within thirty days of the general election to the Assembly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6) The  validity  of  the  election  of  the  President  shall  not  be called in question by or before any court or other authority.
texts.text: (6) The  validity  of  the  election  of  the  President  shall  not  be called in question by or before any court or other authority.

texts.text: Oath of President

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 42. Before  entering  upon  office,  the  President  shall  make  before  the Chief Justice of Pakistan oath in the form set out in the Third Schedule.
texts.text: 42. Before  entering  upon  office,  the  President  shall  make  before  the Chief Justice of Pakistan oath in the form set out in the Third Schedule.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Conditions of President's office
texts.text: Conditions of President's office

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 43. (1) The  President  shall  not  hold  any  office  of  profit  in  the service  of  Pakistan  or  occupy  any  other  position  carrying  the  right  to remuneration for the rendering of services.
texts.text: 43. (1) The  President  shall  not  hold  any  office  of  profit  in  the service  of  Pakistan  or  occupy  any  other  position  carrying  the  right  to remuneration for the rendering of services.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) The  President  shall  not  be  a  candidate  for  election  as  a member of  1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or a Provincial Assembly; and , if a member of 1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or a Provincial Assembly is  elected  as  President,  his  seat  in 1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or, as the case may be, the Provincial Assembly shall become vacant on the day he enters upon his office.
texts.text: (2) The  President  shall  not  be  a  candidate  for  election  as  a member of  1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or a Provincial Assembly; and , if a member of 1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or a Provincial Assembly is  elected  as  President,  his  seat  in 1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or, as the case may be, the Provincial Assembly shall become vacant on the day he enters upon his office.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Term of office of President
texts.text: Term of office of President

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 44. (1) Subject  to  the  Constitution,  the  President  shall  hold  office for a term of five years from the day he enters upon his office :
texts.text: 44. (1) Subject  to  the  Constitution,  the  President  shall  hold  office for a term of five years from the day he enters upon his office :

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Provided that the President shall, notwithstanding the expiration of his terms, continue to hold office until his successor enters upon his office.
texts.text: Provided that the President shall, notwithstanding the expiration of his terms, continue to hold office until his successor enters upon his office.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Subject  to  the  Constitution,  a  person  holding  office  as President shall be eligible for re-election to that office, but no person shall hold that office for more than two consecutive terms.
texts.text: (2) Subject  to  the  Constitution,  a  person  holding  office  as President shall be eligible for re-election to that office, but no person shall hold that office for more than two consecutive terms.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) The President may, by writing under his hand addressed to the Speaker of the National Assembly, resign his office.
texts.text: (3) The President may, by writing under his hand addressed to the Speaker of the National Assembly, resign his office.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: President's power to grant pardon, etc.
texts.text: President's power to grant pardon, etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 45. The  President  shall  have  power  to  grant  pardon,  reprieve  and respite,  and  to  remit,  suspend  or  commute  any  sentence  passed  by  any court, tribunal or other authority.
texts.text: 45. The  President  shall  have  power  to  grant  pardon,  reprieve  and respite,  and  to  remit,  suspend  or  commute  any  sentence  passed  by  any court, tribunal or other authority.

texts.orig: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN
texts.text: CONSTITUTION OF PAKISTAN

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: President to be kept informed
texts.text: President to be kept informed

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 1 [ 46. The  Prime  Minister  shall  keep  the  President  informed  on  all matters of internal and foreign policy and on all legislative proposals the Federal Government intends to bring before Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament).]
texts.text: 1 [ 46. The  Prime  Minister  shall  keep  the  President  informed  on  all matters of internal and foreign policy and on all legislative proposals the Federal Government intends to bring before Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament).]

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Removal 2 [or impeachment] of President
texts.text: Removal 2 [or impeachment] of President

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 47. 3 [(l)  Notwithstanding anything contained in the Constitution, the President  may,  in  accordance  with  the  provisions  of  this  Article,  be removed  from  office  on  the  ground  of  physical  or  mental  incapacity  or impeached on a charge of violating the Constitution or gross misconduct.
texts.text: 47. 3 [(l)  Notwithstanding anything contained in the Constitution, the President  may,  in  accordance  with  the  provisions  of  this  Article,  be removed  from  office  on  the  ground  of  physical  or  mental  incapacity  or impeached on a charge of violating the Constitution or gross misconduct.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Not  less  than  one-half  of  the  total  membership  of  either House may give to the Speaker of the National Assembly or, as the case may be, the Chairman written notice of its intention to move a resolution for the removal of, or, as the case may be, to impeach, the President; and such notice shall set out the particulars of his incapacity or of the charge against him.]
texts.text: (2) Not  less  than  one-half  of  the  total  membership  of  either House may give to the Speaker of the National Assembly or, as the case may be, the Chairman written notice of its intention to move a resolution for the removal of, or, as the case may be, to impeach, the President; and such notice shall set out the particulars of his incapacity or of the charge against him.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (3) If a notice under clause (2) is received by the Chairman, he shall transmit it forthwith to the Speaker.
texts.text: (3) If a notice under clause (2) is received by the Chairman, he shall transmit it forthwith to the Speaker.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) The  Speaker  shall,  within  three  days  of  the  receipt  of  a notice  under  clause  (2)  or  clause  (3),  cause  a  copy  of  the  notice  to  be transmitted to the President.
texts.text: (4) The  Speaker  shall,  within  three  days  of  the  receipt  of  a notice  under  clause  (2)  or  clause  (3),  cause  a  copy  of  the  notice  to  be transmitted to the President.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5) The  Speaker  shall  summon  the  two  Houses  to  meet  in  a joint  sitting  not  earlier  than  seven  days  and  not  later  than  fourteen  days after the receipt of the notice by him.
texts.text: (5) The  Speaker  shall  summon  the  two  Houses  to  meet  in  a joint  sitting  not  earlier  than  seven  days  and  not  later  than  fourteen  days after the receipt of the notice by him.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (6) The joint sitting may investigate or cause to be investigated the ground or the charge upon which the notice is founded.
texts.text: (6) The joint sitting may investigate or cause to be investigated the ground or the charge upon which the notice is founded.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (7) The  President shall have  the right to appear and  be represented during the investigation, if any, and before the joint sitting.
texts.text: (7) The  President shall have  the right to appear and  be represented during the investigation, if any, and before the joint sitting.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (8) If,  after  consideration  of  the  result  of  the  investigation,  if any, a resolution is passed at the joint sitting by the votes of not less than two-thirds  of  the  total  membership  of 4 [Majlis-e-Shoora  (Parliament)] declaring that the President is unfit to hold the office due to incapacity or is guilty of violating the Constitution or of gross misconduct, the President shall cease to hold office immediately on the passing of the resolution.
texts.text: (8) If,  after  consideration  of  the  result  of  the  investigation,  if any, a resolution is passed at the joint sitting by the votes of not less than two-thirds  of  the  total  membership  of 4 [Majlis-e-Shoora  (Parliament)] declaring that the President is unfit to hold the office due to incapacity or is guilty of violating the Constitution or of gross misconduct, the President shall cease to hold office immediately on the passing of the resolution.

texts.orig: President to act on advice, etc.
texts.text: President to act on advice, etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1 [ 48. (1) In the exercise of his functions, the President shall act 2 [on and] in accordance with the advice of the Cabinet 3 [or the Prime Minister]:
texts.text: 1 [ 48. (1) In the exercise of his functions, the President shall act 2 [on and] in accordance with the advice of the Cabinet 3 [or the Prime Minister]:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 4 [Provided that 2 [within fifteen days] the President may require the Cabinet  or,  as  the  case  may  be,  the  Prime  Minister  to  reconsider  such advice, either generally or otherwise, and the President shall 2 [, within ten days,] act in accordance with the advice tendered after such reconsideration.]
texts.text: 4 [Provided that 2 [within fifteen days] the President may require the Cabinet  or,  as  the  case  may  be,  the  Prime  Minister  to  reconsider  such advice, either generally or otherwise, and the President shall 2 [, within ten days,] act in accordance with the advice tendered after such reconsideration.]

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (1), the President shall act in his discretion in respect of any matter in respect of which he is empowered by the Constitution to do so 5 [and the validity of anything  done  by  the  President  in  his  discretion  shall  not  be  called  in question on any ground whatsoever].
texts.text: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (1), the President shall act in his discretion in respect of any matter in respect of which he is empowered by the Constitution to do so 5 [and the validity of anything  done  by  the  President  in  his  discretion  shall  not  be  called  in question on any ground whatsoever].

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) The  question  whether  any,  and  if  so  what,  advice  was tendered to the President by the Cabinet, the Prime Minister, a Minister or Minister of State shall not be inquired into in, or by, any court, tribunal or other authority.
texts.text: (4) The  question  whether  any,  and  if  so  what,  advice  was tendered to the President by the Cabinet, the Prime Minister, a Minister or Minister of State shall not be inquired into in, or by, any court, tribunal or other authority.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 7 [(5) Where  the  President  dissolves  the  National  Assembly, notwithstanding anything contained in clause (1), he shall, -
texts.text: 7 [(5) Where  the  President  dissolves  the  National  Assembly, notwithstanding anything contained in clause (1), he shall, -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) appoint  a  date,  not  later  than  ninety  days  from  the date  of  the  dissolution,  for  the  holding  of  a  general election to the Assembly ; and
texts.text: (a) appoint  a  date,  not  later  than  ninety  days  from  the date  of  the  dissolution,  for  the  holding  of  a  general election to the Assembly ; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) appoint a care-taker Cabinet 8 [in accordance with the provisions of Article 224 or, as the case may be, Article 224A]]
texts.text: (b) appoint a care-taker Cabinet 8 [in accordance with the provisions of Article 224 or, as the case may be, Article 224A]]

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 7 [(6)  If  at  any  time  the  Prime  Minister  considers it  necessary  to hold a referendum on any matter of national importance, he may refer the matter  to  a  joint  sitting  of  the  Majlis-e-Shoora  (Parliament)  and  if  it  is approved in a joint sitting, the Prime Minister may cause such matter to be referred to a referendum in the form of a question that is capable of being answered by either 'Yes' or 'No'.]
texts.text: 7 [(6)  If  at  any  time  the  Prime  Minister  considers it  necessary  to hold a referendum on any matter of national importance, he may refer the matter  to  a  joint  sitting  of  the  Majlis-e-Shoora  (Parliament)  and  if  it  is approved in a joint sitting, the Prime Minister may cause such matter to be referred to a referendum in the form of a question that is capable of being answered by either 'Yes' or 'No'.]

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Chairman  or  Speaker  to  act  as,  or  perform  functions  of, President
texts.text: Chairman  or  Speaker  to  act  as,  or  perform  functions  of, President

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 49. (1) If  the  office  of  President  becomes  vacant  by  reason  of death,  resignation  or  removal  of  the  President,  the  Chairman  or,  if  he  is unable to perform the functions of the office of President, the Speaker of the National Assembly shall act as President until a President is elected in accordance with clause (3) of Article 41.
texts.text: 49. (1) If  the  office  of  President  becomes  vacant  by  reason  of death,  resignation  or  removal  of  the  President,  the  Chairman  or,  if  he  is unable to perform the functions of the office of President, the Speaker of the National Assembly shall act as President until a President is elected in accordance with clause (3) of Article 41.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2)    When the President, by reason of absence from Pakistan or any other cause, is unable to perform his functions, the Chairman or, if he too is absent or unable to perform the functions of the office of President, the  Speaker  of  the  National  Assembly  shall  perform  the  functions  of President  until  the  President  returns  to  Pakistan  or,  as  the  case  may  be, resumes his functions.
texts.text: (2)    When the President, by reason of absence from Pakistan or any other cause, is unable to perform his functions, the Chairman or, if he too is absent or unable to perform the functions of the office of President, the  Speaker  of  the  National  Assembly  shall  perform  the  functions  of President  until  the  President  returns  to  Pakistan  or,  as  the  case  may  be, resumes his functions.

texts.text: (a) the  constituencies  for  the  general  seats  shall  be  single member  territorial  constituencies  and  the  members  to  fill such  seats  shall  be  elected  by  direct  and  free  vote  in accordance with law;

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Duration of National Assembly
texts.text: Duration of National Assembly

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 52. The National Assembly shall, unless sooner dissolved, continue for a  term  of  five  years  from  the  day  of  its  first  meeting  and  shall  stand dissolved at the expiration of its term.
texts.text: 52. The National Assembly shall, unless sooner dissolved, continue for a  term  of  five  years  from  the  day  of  its  first  meeting  and  shall  stand dissolved at the expiration of its term.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Speaker and Deputy Speaker of National Assembly
texts.text: Speaker and Deputy Speaker of National Assembly

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 53. (1)    After a general election, the National Assembly shall, at its first  meeting  and  to  the  exclusion  of  any  other  business,  elect  from amongst its members a Speaker and a Deputy Speaker and, so often as the office of Speaker or Deputy Speaker becomes vacant, the Assembly shall elect another member as Speaker or, as the case may be, Deputy Speaker.
texts.text: 53. (1)    After a general election, the National Assembly shall, at its first  meeting  and  to  the  exclusion  of  any  other  business,  elect  from amongst its members a Speaker and a Deputy Speaker and, so often as the office of Speaker or Deputy Speaker becomes vacant, the Assembly shall elect another member as Speaker or, as the case may be, Deputy Speaker.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) Before entering upon office, a member elected as Speaker or Deputy Speaker shall make before the National Assembly oath in the form set out in the Third Schedule.
texts.text: (2) Before entering upon office, a member elected as Speaker or Deputy Speaker shall make before the National Assembly oath in the form set out in the Third Schedule.

texts.orig: (3) When  the  office  of  Speaker  is  vacant,  or  the  Speaker  is absent or is unable to perform his functions due to any cause, the Deputy Speaker shall act  as  speaker,  and  if,  at  that  time,  the  Deputy  Speaker  is also absent or is unable to act as Speaker due to any cause, such member as  may  be  determined  by  the  rules  of  procedure  of  the  Assembly  shall preside at the meeting of the Assembly.
texts.text: (3) When  the  office  of  Speaker  is  vacant,  or  the  Speaker  is absent or is unable to perform his functions due to any cause, the Deputy Speaker shall act  as  speaker,  and  if,  at  that  time,  the  Deputy  Speaker  is also absent or is unable to act as Speaker due to any cause, such member as  may  be  determined  by  the  rules  of  procedure  of  the  Assembly  shall preside at the meeting of the Assembly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) The Speaker or the Deputy Speaker shall not preside at a meeting of the Assembly when a resolution for his removal from office is being considered.

texts.text: (3) On a requisition signed by not less than one-fourth of the total membership of the National Assembly, the Speaker shall summon the National Assembly to meet, at such time and place as he thinks fit, within fourteen days of the receipt of the requisition; and when the Speaker has summoned the Assembly only he may prorogue it.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Voting in Assembly and quorum
texts.text: Voting in Assembly and quorum

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 55. (1) Subject  to  the  Constitution,  all  decisions  of  the  National Assembly shall be taken by majority of the members present and voting, but the person presiding shall not vote except in the case of equality of votes.
texts.text: 55. (1) Subject  to  the  Constitution,  all  decisions  of  the  National Assembly shall be taken by majority of the members present and voting, but the person presiding shall not vote except in the case of equality of votes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) If at any time during a sitting of the National Assembly the attention  of  the  person  presiding  is  drawn  to  the  fact  that  less  than  onefourth of the total membership of the Assembly is present, he shall either adjourn the Assembly or suspend the meeting until at least one-fourth of such membership is present.
texts.text: (2) If at any time during a sitting of the National Assembly the attention  of  the  person  presiding  is  drawn  to  the  fact  that  less  than  onefourth of the total membership of the Assembly is present, he shall either adjourn the Assembly or suspend the meeting until at least one-fourth of such membership is present.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 57. The Prime Minister, a Federal Minister, a Minister of State and the Attorney General shall have the right to speak and otherwise take part in the  proceedings  of  either  House,  or  a  joint  sitting  or  any  committee thereof, of which he may be named a member, but shall not by virtue of this Article be entitled to vote.
texts.text: 57. The Prime Minister, a Federal Minister, a Minister of State and the Attorney General shall have the right to speak and otherwise take part in the  proceedings  of  either  House,  or  a  joint  sitting  or  any  committee thereof, of which he may be named a member, but shall not by virtue of this Article be entitled to vote.

texts.orig: 3 [ 58. (1)    The  President  shall  dissolve  the  National  Assembly  if  so advised by the Prime Minister; and the National Assembly shall, unless sooner  dissolved,  stand  dissolved  at  the  expiration  of  forty-eight  hours after the Prime Minister has so advised.
texts.text: 3 [ 58. (1)    The  President  shall  dissolve  the  National  Assembly  if  so advised by the Prime Minister; and the National Assembly shall, unless sooner  dissolved,  stand  dissolved  at  the  expiration  of  forty-eight  hours after the Prime Minister has so advised.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Explanation . -Reference in this Article to "Prime Minister" shall not be construed to include reference to a Prime Minister against whom a notice of a resolution for a vote of no-confidence has been given in the National Assembly but has not been voted upon or against whom such a resolution  has  been  passed  or  who  is  continuing  in  office  after  his resignation or after the dissolution of the National Assembly.
texts.text: Explanation . -Reference in this Article to "Prime Minister" shall not be construed to include reference to a Prime Minister against whom a notice of a resolution for a vote of no-confidence has been given in the National Assembly but has not been voted upon or against whom such a resolution  has  been  passed  or  who  is  continuing  in  office  after  his resignation or after the dissolution of the National Assembly.

texts.orig: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (2) of Article 48, the President may also dissolve the National Assembly in his discretion where, a vote of no-confidence having been passed against the Prime Minister, no other member of the National Assembly command the confidence of the majority of the members of the National Assembly in accordance  with  the  provisions  of  the  Constitution,  as  ascertained  in  a session of the National Assembly summoned for the purpose.]
texts.text: (2) Notwithstanding anything contained in clause (2) of Article 48, the President may also dissolve the National Assembly in his discretion where, a vote of no-confidence having been passed against the Prime Minister, no other member of the National Assembly command the confidence of the majority of the members of the National Assembly in accordance  with  the  provisions  of  the  Constitution,  as  ascertained  in  a session of the National Assembly summoned for the purpose.]

texts.text: (2) A member of a House shall be deemed to be a member of a Parliamentary Party if he, having been elected as a candidate or nominee of a political party which constitutes the Parliamentary Party in the House or,  having  been  elected  otherwise  than  as  a  candidate  or  nominee  of  a political  party,  has  become  a  member  of  such  Parliamentary  Party  after such election by means of a declaration in writing.

texts.orig: (3) Upon  receipt  of  the  declaration under  clause  (1), the Presiding Officer of the House shall within two days refer, and in case he fails to do so it shall be deemed that he has referred, the declaration to the Chief  Election  Commissioner  who  shall  lay  the  declaration  before  the Election Commission for its decision thereon confirming the declaration or  otherwise  within  thirty  days  of  its  receipt  by  the  Chief  Election Commissioner.
texts.text: (3) Upon  receipt  of  the  declaration under  clause  (1), the Presiding Officer of the House shall within two days refer, and in case he fails to do so it shall be deemed that he has referred, the declaration to the Chief  Election  Commissioner  who  shall  lay  the  declaration  before  the Election Commission for its decision thereon confirming the declaration or  otherwise  within  thirty  days  of  its  receipt  by  the  Chief  Election Commissioner.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (4) Where the Election Commission confirms the declaration, the  member  referred  to  in  clause  (1)  shall  cease  to  be  a  member  of  the House and his seat shall become vacant.
texts.text: (4) Where the Election Commission confirms the declaration, the  member  referred  to  in  clause  (1)  shall  cease  to  be  a  member  of  the House and his seat shall become vacant.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (5) Any  party  aggrieved  by  the decision of the Election Commission  may,  within  thirty  days,  prefer  an  appeal  to  the  Supreme Court which shall decide the matter within ninety days from the date of the filing of the appeal.

texts.text: 2 [ 70. (1)    A Bill with respect to any matter in the Federal Legislative List may originate in either House and shall, if it is passed by the House in which it originated, be transmitted to the other House; and, if the Bill is passed without amendment by the other House also, it shall be presented to the President for assent.

texts.text: (2) If a Bill transmitted to a House under clause (1) is passed with amendments it shall be sent back to the House in which it originated and  if  that  House  passes  the  Bill  with  those  amendments  it  shall  be presented to the President for assent.

texts.text: (2) For the purposes of this Chapter, a Bill or amendment shall be deemed to be a Money Bill if it contains provisions dealing with all or any of the following matters, namely: -

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) the imposition, abolition, remission, alteration or regulation of any tax;
texts.text: (a) the imposition, abolition, remission, alteration or regulation of any tax;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) the borrowing of money, or the giving of any guarantee, by the  Federal  Government,  or  the  amendment  of  the  law relating to the financial obligations of that Government;
texts.text: (b) the borrowing of money, or the giving of any guarantee, by the  Federal  Government,  or  the  amendment  of  the  law relating to the financial obligations of that Government;

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (c) the custody of the Federal Consolidated Fund, the payment of moneys into, or the issue of moneys from, that Fund;

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (d) the  imposition  of  a  charge  upon  the  Federal  Consolidated Fund, or the abolition or alteration of any such charge;

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (b) for the imposition, abolition, remission, alteration or regulation  of  any  tax  by  any  local  authority  or  body  for local purposes.

A  Money  Bill,  or  a  Bill  or  amendment  which  if  enacted  and brought  into  operation  would  involve  expenditure  from  the  Federal Consolidated Fund  or withdrawal from the Public Account  of the Federation or affect the coinage or currency of Pakistan or the constitution or  functions  of  the  State  Bank  of  Pakistan  shall  not  be  introduced  or moved in  1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] except by or with the consent of the Federal Government.
texts.text: 74. A  Money  Bill,  or  a  Bill  or  amendment  which  if  enacted  and brought  into  operation  would  involve  expenditure  from  the  Federal Consolidated Fund  or withdrawal from the Public Account  of the Federation or affect the coinage or currency of Pakistan or the constitution or  functions  of  the  State  Bank  of  Pakistan  shall  not  be  introduced  or moved in  1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] except by or with the consent of the Federal Government.

texts.text: (b) in the case of a Bill other than a Money Bill, return the Bill to the Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament) with a message requesting that the Bill or any specified provision thereof, be  reconsidered  and  that  any  amendment  specified  in  the message be considered.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4 [(2) When  the  President  has  returned  a  Bill  to  the  Majlis-eShoora  (Parliament),  it  shall  be  reconsidered  by  the  Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)  in  joint  sitting  and,  if  it  is  again  passed,  with  or  without amendment,  by  the  Majlis-e-Shoora  (Parliament),  by  the  votes  of  the majority  of  the  members  of  both  Houses  present  and  voting,  it  shall  be deemed for the purposes of the Constitution to have been passed by both Houses  and  shall  be  presented  to  the  President,  and  the  President  shall give his assent within ten days, failing which such assent shall be deemed to have been given.]
texts.text: 4 [(2) When  the  President  has  returned  a  Bill  to  the  Majlis-eShoora  (Parliament),  it  shall  be  reconsidered  by  the  Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)  in  joint  sitting  and,  if  it  is  again  passed,  with  or  without amendment,  by  the  Majlis-e-Shoora  (Parliament),  by  the  votes  of  the majority  of  the  members  of  both  Houses  present  and  voting,  it  shall  be deemed for the purposes of the Constitution to have been passed by both Houses  and  shall  be  presented  to  the  President,  and  the  President  shall give his assent within ten days, failing which such assent shall be deemed to have been given.]

texts.text: Bill not to lapse on prorogation, etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 76. (1)    A Bill pending in either House shall not lapse by reason of the prorogation of the House.
texts.text: 76. (1)    A Bill pending in either House shall not lapse by reason of the prorogation of the House.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (2) A Bill pending in the Senate which has not been passed by the National Assembly shall not lapse on the dissolution of the National Assembly.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: (3) A Bill pending in the National Assembly, or a Bill which having  been  passed  by  the  National  Assembly  is  pending  in  the  Senate, shall lapse on the dissolution of the National Assembly.

texts.text: Federal Consolidated Fund and Public Account

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 78. (1)    All  revenues  received  by  the  Federal  Government,  all  loans raised by that Government, and all moneys received by it in repayment of any  loan,  shall  form  part  of  a  consolidated  fund,  to  be  known  as  the Federal Consolidated Fund.
texts.text: 78. (1)    All  revenues  received  by  the  Federal  Government,  all  loans raised by that Government, and all moneys received by it in repayment of any  loan,  shall  form  part  of  a  consolidated  fund,  to  be  known  as  the Federal Consolidated Fund.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Custody,  etc.,  of  Federal  Consolidated  Fund  and  Public Account
texts.text: Custody,  etc.,  of  Federal  Consolidated  Fund  and  Public Account

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 79. The  custody  of  the  Federal  Consolidated  Fund,  the  payment  of moneys into that Fund, the withdrawal of moneys therefrom, the custody of other moneys received by or on behalf of the Federal Government, their payment into, and withdrawal from, the Public Account of the Federation, and all matters connected with or ancillary to the matters aforesaid shall be regulated by Act of 1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or, until provision in that behalf is so made, by rules made by the President.
texts.text: 79. The  custody  of  the  Federal  Consolidated  Fund,  the  payment  of moneys into that Fund, the withdrawal of moneys therefrom, the custody of other moneys received by or on behalf of the Federal Government, their payment into, and withdrawal from, the Public Account of the Federation, and all matters connected with or ancillary to the matters aforesaid shall be regulated by Act of 1 [Majlis-e-Shoora (Parliament)] or, until provision in that behalf is so made, by rules made by the President.

texts.label: section_header

texts.text: Annual Budget Statement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 80. (1)    The  Federal  Government shall,  in  respect  of  every  financial year,  cause  to  be  laid  before  the  National  Assembly  a  statement  of  the estimated receipt and expenditure of the Federal Government for that year, in this Part, referred to as the Annual Budget Statement.
texts.text: 80. (1)    The  Federal  Government shall,  in  respect  of  every  financial year,  cause  to  be  laid  before  the  National  Assembly  a  statement  of  the estimated receipt and expenditure of the Federal Government for that year, in this Part, referred to as the Annual Budget Statement.

texts.text: Procedure relating to Annual Budget Statement

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 82. (1) So  much  of  the  Annual  Budget  Statement  as  relates  to expenditure charged upon the Federal Consolidated Fund may  be discussed  in,  but  shall  not  be  submitted  to  the  vote  of,  the  National Assembly.
texts.text: 82. (1) So  much  of  the  Annual  Budget  Statement  as  relates  to expenditure charged upon the Federal Consolidated Fund may  be discussed  in,  but  shall  not  be  submitted  to  the  vote  of,  the  National Assembly.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (2) So much of the Annual Budget Statement as relates to other expenditure  shall  be  submitted  to  the  National  Assembly  in  the  form  of demands for grants, and the Assembly shall have power to assent to, or to refuse to assent to, any demand, or to assent to any demand subject to a reduction of the amount specified therein:
texts.text: (2) So much of the Annual Budget Statement as relates to other expenditure  shall  be  submitted  to  the  National  Assembly  in  the  form  of demands for grants, and the Assembly shall have power to assent to, or to refuse to assent to, any demand, or to assent to any demand subject to a reduction of the amount specified therein:

texts.text: (b) the several sums required to meet the expenditure charged upon the Federal Consolidated Fund but not exceeding, in the  case  of  any  sum,  the  sum  shown  in  the  statement previously laid before the National Assembly.

texts.text: (2) The  schedule  so  authenticated  shall  be  laid  before  the National Assembly, but shall not be open to discussion or vote thereon.

texts.text: (3) Subject to the Constitution, no expenditure from the Federal Consolidated Fund shall be deemed to be duly authorised unless it is  specified  in  the  schedule  so  authenticated  and  such  schedule  is  laid before the National Assembly as required by clause (2).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 85. Notwithstanding  anything  contained  in  the  foregoing  provisions relating  to  financial  matters,  the  National  Assembly  shall  have  power  to make any grant in advance in respect of the estimated expenditure for a part of any financial year, not exceeding four months, pending completion of the procedure prescribed in Article 82 for the voting of such grant and the authentication of the schedule of authorized expenditure in accordance with the provisions of Article 83 in relation to the expenditure.
texts.text: 85. Notwithstanding  anything  contained  in  the  foregoing  provisions relating  to  financial  matters,  the  National  Assembly  shall  have  power  to make any grant in advance in respect of the estimated expenditure for a part of any financial year, not exceeding four months, pending completion of the procedure prescribed in Article 82 for the voting of such grant and the authentication of the schedule of authorized expenditure in accordance with the provisions of Article 83 in relation to the expenditure.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Power to authorize expenditure when Assembly stands dissolved
texts.text: Power to authorize expenditure when Assembly stands dissolved

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 86. Notwithstanding  anything  contained  in  the  foregoing  provisions relating  to  financial  matters,  at  any  time  when  the  National  Assembly stands dissolved, the Federal Government may authorize expenditure from the Federal Consolidated Fund in respect of the estimated expenditure for a  period  not  exceeding  four  months  in  any  financial  year,  pending completion  of  the  procedure  prescribed  in  Article  82  for  the  voting  of grants and the authentication of the schedule of authorized expenditure in accordance with the provisions of Article 83 in relation to the expenditure.
texts.text: 86. Notwithstanding  anything  contained  in  the  foregoing  provisions relating  to  financial  matters,  at  any  time  when  the  National  Assembly stands dissolved, the Federal Government may authorize expenditure from the Federal Consolidated Fund in respect of the estimated expenditure for a  period  not  exceeding  four  months  in  any  financial  year,  pending completion  of  the  procedure  prescribed  in  Article  82  for  the  voting  of grants and the authentication of the schedule of authorized expenditure in accordance with the provisions of Article 83 in relation to the expenditure.

texts.text: (2) 1 [Majlis-e-Shoora  (Parliament)]  may  by  law  regulate  the recruitment  and  the  conditions  of  service  of  persons  appointed  to  the secretarial staff of either House.
